page.title: 10BUILDINGS in RHAYADER
page.content: Housing in the Rhayader area falls into 3 main categories:privately owned and occupied,privately owned and let, and council owned.There are no blocks of flats only 2 small buildings mainly for the use of senior citizens. A pro- portion of the original council houses are now owner occupied. The oldest buildings were built around the crossroads in the late 16th and 17th centuries.The Castle Hotel used to be a 16th century coaching inn.The Old Swan,a former inn and now a tourist office,was built in 1683 and the Corner Shop was built in 1694.The Workhouse built outside the town in 19th century later became The Royal Cambrian School for the Deaf and is now holiday flats and restaurant.The Town Clock,the War Memorial,stands at the crossroads,proving an obstacle to the flow of modern day traffic.
